title: High Military Workforce
description: In 2020, 13.36% of Eritrea's total labor force was comprised of armed forces personnel, indicating a significant military presence relative to the workforce.

title: Low Business Regulatory Environment
description: Eritrea scored 1 out of 6 in the CPIA business regulatory environment rating in 2023, highlighting challenges in business regulations.

title: Poor Financial Management
description: The CPIA quality of budgetary and financial management rating for Eritrea was 1 out of 6 in 2023, indicating weak financial governance.

title: Underdeveloped Financial Sector
description: In 2023, Eritrea's CPIA financial sector rating was 1 out of 6, reflecting a need for significant financial sector improvements.

title: Limited Revenue Mobilization Efficiency
description: Eritrea's CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating was 2 out of 6 in 2023, suggesting inefficiencies in revenue collection.

title: Weak Structural Policies
description: The CPIA structural policies cluster average for Eritrea was 1.17 out of 6 in 2023, indicating underdeveloped structural policies.

title: Low Trade Rating
description: Eritrea scored 1.5 out of 6 in the CPIA trade rating in 2023, highlighting challenges in trade policies and practices.

title: High Corruption and Low Transparency
description: In 2023, Eritrea's CPIA transparency, accountability, and corruption in the public sector rating was 1 out of 6, indicating significant governance issues.

title: Poor Data Infrastructure
description: Eritrea's statistical performance indicators for data infrastructure scored 10 out of 100 in 2023, reflecting inadequate data systems.

title: Minimal Secure Internet Servers
description: In 2023, Eritrea had only 1 secure Internet server, indicating limited digital security infrastructure.

title: Low Logistics Performance
description: Eritrea's logistics performance index for shipment timeliness was 2.08 out of 5 in 2018, suggesting inefficiencies in logistics.

title: High Open Defecation Rates
description: In 2016, 67% of Eritrea's population practiced open defecation, with 88.65% in rural areas, indicating severe sanitation challenges.

title: Negative Aid Flow from Switzerland
description: In 2022, Eritrea experienced a net negative bilateral aid flow of $100,000 from Switzerland, reflecting a decrease in aid support.

title: Low Regulatory Quality
description: Eritrea's regulatory quality percentile rank was 0.47 in 2023, indicating poor regulatory standards.
